headline: Timeshares Have Made a Comeback. Can Their Stocks?
summary: Like other vacationers, timeshare owners are looking to get away from it all—including the business’  poor reputation.  Lilienfeld has sometimes run into hassles booking trips, and as an attorney, she’s well aware that timeshares aren’t good estate planning tools, as they’re sometimes advertised.  Average occupancy hit a postpandemic high of 80% in 2024, well ahead of the hotel occupancy rate in the mid-60% range, while rental revenue has ballooned by $1 billion since 2021, reaching a record $3.2 billion last year.
